author: SaintElsewhere
title: Meh
review: I got this for my birthday several years ago from a hockey-obsessed friend. I never really used it as I have never been into hockey. It's rather simple compared to the Lego I like and so is hardly my cup of tea, so to speak. I never really thought the trigger was that great, but I did like the interchangeable faces and the water bottle packaging.

author: BaneShake
title: Flip Shot Review
review:
As I said with slap shot, the moving is a great innovation. Here are the pros and cons.
   The good: bright and fun-looking
                  the movement is better than that of slap shot
                  fun to use with other hockey sets
   The bad: very limited ways to use it

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Sports (Hockey) - Flip Shot Review
review:
This set may doesn't have a lot of play features but it's still a good set to have. This figure is very easy to build and very easy to maneuver as well. We also get a few stickers to worry about. What's interesting about this set is that you can use the canister as a bottle if you want. The play feature is the same as in the other LEGO Sports (Hockey) hockey player figure sets: The head can be pushed down if you want to move the hockey stick which is going to hit the puck. It's a good set to have - even for pieces which you can use for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms.

All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

author: tkettle9719
title: An unusually good find...
review:
I'm not a big sports fan, but I instantly fell in love with this set when my mom got it many years ago for me at Tuesday morning while on vacation.

Pros

  • -The mask changes, while I don't really use them, are fun to change, or even as sub pucks.
  • -This product has many Bionicle parts (happy me).
  • …

Cons

  • -Maybe some legs. I get why, but it would make the product realistic.
  • -This set has some Technic elements that are much too noticeable.
  • …

This set is good, and does look nice, but does have flaws. I recommend it, but if you're big into detail, don't take the pros and cons lightly.
